title: T-Rex, Biggest Land Predator Ever, Took 40 Years To Reach Full Size: Study
content: There is no question that Tyrannosaurus rex got big. In fact, this fearsome dinosaur may have been Earth's most massive land predator of all time. But the question of how quickly T-rex achieved its maximum size has been a matter of debate.

title: Lashkar Commander's Admission On Op Sindoor's Success, Pak's Terror Policy
content: In a stunning public admission that cuts through years of denials and diplomatic doublespeak, the commander of Pakistan-based terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), Hafiz Abdul Rauf, has acknowledged that India's Operation Sindoor delivered a blow.

content: The Enforcement Directorate has shared a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat with the Supreme Court in which lawyers are purportedly being asked to assemble in the courtroom.

title: Air India Delhi-New York Flight Engine Sucks In Baggage Container, Damaged
content: An Air India aircraft was damaged this morning after a baggage container was sucked into its engine at Delhi Airport. The incident occurred when the Airbus A350 was taxiing in dense fog at the airport, the airline said.

title: Iran Brings In Iraqi Militia To Crack Down On Protesters Amid US Threats
content: Foreign militia, in the guise of Shia pilgrims, are reportedly entering Iran to help crush the nationwide unrest against Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei's regime.

content: To understand why the Gulf is so nervous, it is worth spelling out what Iran is pointing at. The US maintains a dense military presence across the region. That is what may come under Iranian fire.

title: 'More Positions Than Kama Sutra': UK PM Mocks Tories On Policy U-Turn
content: His remark came in defence of his government against criticism over repeated U-turns on mandatory digital ID cards for workers in Britain.

title: US Redeploying South China Sea Carrier To Middle East Amid Tensions With Iran
content: The US it is redeploying a carrier strike group from the South China Sea to the US Central Command (CENTCOM) area of responsibility, which includes the Middle East. The development comes amid the rising tensions between US and Iran.

title: When Boston Was Shocked By Deadly Molasses Flood On This Day In 1919
content: Over 106 years ago, Boston's North End faced one of the most bizarre and tragic disasters in history. On January 15, 1919, a storage tank holding 2.3 million US gallons of molasses suddenly burst, claiming 21 lives and injuring around 150 people.

title: 78th Army Day Parade: BrahMos Missiles, Bhishma Tanks Roll Through Jaipur
content: The Army Day parade, held in Jagatpura, featured BrahMos missiles, Pinaka multi-barrel rocket launchers, Bhishma and Arjun tanks, and advanced combat systems moving through public roads.

title: At Akal Takht, Bhagwant Mann Dismisses Viral Video As AI-Generated
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has for the first time addressed the controversy surrounding a viral video of him allegedly making objectionable remarks.

title: "Emotions Can't Go Out Of Hand": Top Court On Mamata Banerjee vs Probe Agency
content: The Supreme Court today said it is "very much disturbed" by the chaos in the Calcutta High Court during the hearing related to the ongoing face-off between the Enforcement Directorate and the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress.

title: 242 Debit Cards, 58 Phones: How Bengaluru Dropout, Mother Ran Cyber Scam
content: A 22-year-old college dropout from Bengaluru allegedly built a sophisticated cybercrime operation that moved hundreds of crores through mule bank accounts with his mother playing a key role.

title: With Shades On Face, Dogs March In Style At 78th Army Day Parade In Jaipur
content: With the Prime Minister's push for Atmanirbhar Bharat (self-reliant India), the Indian Army has inducted indigenous dog breeds and is training them for detection, surveillance, and counterinsurgency operations.

title: Would Trump Meet Zelensky At World Economic Forum In Davos? What He Said
content: US President Donald Trump said that Ukraine - not Russia - is holding up a potential peace deal, rhetoric that stands in marked contrast to that of European allies, who have consistently argued Moscow has little interest in ending its war in Ukraine.

title: NLCIL signs MoU with Gujarat for development of large-scale renewable energy projects
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Mamata vs ED: Bengal CM suffers SC blow; FIRs stayed, notices issued - what top court said
content: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and state officials regarding allegations by the ED of interference during raids on I-PAC. The court also restrained the state police from probing the FIR against ED.

title: Maha civic polls: Indelible ink erased? State election panel clarifies, warns voters
content: In a decisive move, the Maharashtra Election Commission has labeled the removal of indelible ink as a serious breach of electoral conduct amidst reports of voters attempting to register multiple votes in local body elections. Although some argue that the ink can be easily wiped off, the SEC emphasizes that their meticulous voting records are designed to thwart this practice.

title: Bulldozers clearing bodies from streets: Iranians in India reveal horror of deadly protests
content: Reports from Iran paint a grim picture: overflowing hospitals, streets cleared by earthmovers, and families charged for their children's bullets. Protests have morphed into a struggle for survival, with citizens facing severe economic hardship and brutal crackdowns. Iranians abroad are raising their voices, seeking support and highlighting the dire situation back home.

title: Bangladesh cricket in crisis: BCB sacks director after players boycott BPL
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board director M Nazmul Islam has been removed from all his duties. This decision came after cricketers demanded his resignation. The controversy erupted over his remarks regarding player remuneration and the country's potential withdrawal from the T20 World Cup. Players threatened to boycott cricket if he did not step down.

title: ‘Stop coding’, says Nvidia CEO to engineers; says this is what they should do instead
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: Watch: Air India plane engine damaged after it sucks in container
content: Air India's Airbus A350, en route to New York, returned to Delhi due to Iranian airspace closure. Subsequently, while taxiing in dense fog, an unsecured container was ingested into its right engine. The aircraft is now grounded for repairs, impacting Air India's widebody capacity and highlighting airside safety concerns.

title: What bothers Gen Z most at work? Imbalance, micromanagers, and no growth
content: Gen Z is redefining the modern workplace, but not without cost. Naukri’s report on over 23,000 professionals reveals mental health stressors rooted in poor work-life balance, stagnation, lack of meaningful recognition, and micromanagement. This generation seeks growth, autonomy, and boundaries, highlighting a silent crisis: the struggle to thrive at work without losing themselves to anxiety, fatigue, and disengagement.

title: Gates Foundation shut down begins: $9bn outlay, 500 jobs to go; closure set for 2045
content: Bill Gates is initiating the phased closure of his influential foundation by 2045, with a record $9 billion budget planned for 2026. The organization will cut up to 500 staff positions over five years to manage operating costs.

title: Big blow! Washington Sundar racing against time to be fit for T20 World Cup - exclusive
content: India's T20 World Cup hopes face a significant setback as all-rounder Washington Sundar is battling a serious injury.  He is set to miss the upcoming T20 series against New Zealand and faces a race against time for the World Cup.  A thorough assessment at the BCCI Centre of Excellence will determine his recovery timeline.

title: Watch: Shashi Tharoor grooves to Taylor Swift's 'The Fate of Ophelia'; wins internet
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor delighted netizens by sharing an Instagram reel dancing to Taylor Swift's 'The Fate of Ophelia.'  The politician, amidst a mountain of work, showcased a playful side, humorously noting his transformation into a "Swiftie." The charming video, filmed in his study, quickly garnered a massive positive response online, with fans celebrating this unexpected pop culture moment.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Sleep optimization is the new fitness frontier, say experts
content: Fitness is shifting from prioritizing exhaustion to optimizing recovery, with sleep emerging as crucial for performance. Experts highlight sleep's role in muscle repair, hormone regulation, and cardiovascular health, while common mistakes like inconsistent schedules and screen time hinder progress. Prioritizing sleep is now seen as essential for achieving fitness goals.

title: Ceiling fan sold for cremation to Rs 157-cr business: Gwalior woman’s success story
content: An emotional story of a woman who, starting with no capital from her home, built a packaging powerhouse with a ₹157 crore turnover. Facing immense personal and financial adversity, her resilience, focus on quality, and innovative spirit propelled her to success, serving over 50,000 clients with sustainable solutions.

title: Hardik Pandya flies kites with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma in Jaipur – Watch
content: Hardik Pandya's festive kite-flying with Mahieka Sharma in Jaipur went viral, sparking discussions about his fitness.  Despite being sidelined from the ongoing ODI series against New Zealand due to bowling workload concerns, Pandya showcased strong all-round form in domestic cricket. He is expected to return for the upcoming T20I series, crucial for India's T20 World Cup preparations.

title: Who is Dr Nisha Verma? US senator asks Indian-origin doctor if men can get pregnant
content: Dr. Nisha Verma, an OB-GYN and reproductive health expert, faced intense questioning from Senator Josh Hawley regarding whether men can get pregnant during a US Senate hearing. This exchange, focusing on abortion pill safety, ignited widespread debate on gender identity and reproductive rights. Dr.

title: Watch: IAF joins op to fight massive Nanda Devi forest fire; Mi-17 V5 helicopter deployed
content: The Indian Air Force swiftly deployed an Mi-17 V5 helicopter to combat a forest fire in Uttarakhand's Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve. Responding to a state government request, the IAF's Central Air Command engaged in firefighting operations in the rocky terrain. Aerial surveillance confirms the Valley of Flowers and Hemkund Sahib remain safe amidst ongoing efforts.

title: Watch: Nasa carries out first-ever medical evacuation; Crew-11 splashes down
content: Four International Space Station crewmembers, including Americans Mike Fincke and Zena Cardman, returned to Earth early Thursday after a medical issue forced an early mission end. This marked the first medical evacuation in the ISS program.  Nasa cited medical privacy for not identifying the astronaut or details of the health concern, emphasizing the situation was not an emergency.

title: CBSE recruitment city intimation date out: Check here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will release city intimation slips for the Direct Recruitment Quota Examination 2026 (DRQ 2026) on January 17, 2026. These slips will inform candidates about their allotted exam city, helping them plan travel and accommodation. However, they are not admit cards; the official admit card with centre details and reporting time will be issued separately.

title: 'Skipped tournament due to Delhi air': Danish shuttler shares AQI screenshot
content: Danish badminton player Anders Antonsen withdrew from the India Open for the third consecutive year, citing "extreme" air pollution in Delhi. He believes the current pollution levels make the city unsuitable for hosting a badminton tournament, following similar concerns raised by his compatriot Mia Blichfeldt.

title: Travis Kelce makes emotional life choice with Taylor Swift amid retirement buzz
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are currently gearing up for their lavish wedding which is all set to be held this summer. Amid wedding plans, Travis Kelce is also dealing with strong retirement rumors as fans continue to troll his performance in the ongoing season. It seems this has influenced Travis Kelce to make a pretty heartfelt decision about his life.

title: Family over money: Did Messi decline 1.4bn euros? Al Ittihad chief reveals Saudi offer
content: Al Ittihad president Anmar Al Haili revealed Lionel Messi rejected a staggering 1.4 billion euro offer per year from the Saudi club. Messi prioritised his family over the immense financial package, opting instead for a move to Inter Miami. Saudi Arabia's ambition to attract top talent remains strong, with Cristiano Ronaldo already a key figure.

title: Budget 2026: Agri sector lays out its pitch — tech push, climate-smart infra & more
content: As the FY27 Budget nears, agriculture stakeholders are pushing for increased investment in technology, digital systems, and climate-ready infrastructure. Experts advocate for a shift from welfare to growth, emphasizing productivity, rural demand, and resilience. Targeted support for the dairy sector, climate-resilient infrastructure, and digital agriculture are highlighted as crucial for long-term economic expansion and food security.

title: Farmer suicides in Marathwada: 1,129 deaths recorded in 2025, highest in 5 years
content: The year 2025 marked a tragic chapter for Marathwada, as the region faced an alarming surge in farmer suicides, peaking at 1,129—an average of nearly three per day. The unpredictable climate, especially heavy rainfall, obliterated vital crops such as soybean, driving farmers deeper into financial turmoil.

title: 2 held in Lucknow for killing friend over ‘who would arrange liquor’
content: Lucknow police swiftly apprehended two friends within 72 hours for the brutal murder of Sachin Tiwari. A drunken argument over alcohol escalated into a fatal assault, with the victim allegedly struck and then his throat slit. The accused then attempted to conceal the crime by burning the body, but were apprehended through diligent investigation.

title: Older than Milky Way: Scientists study signals older than 13 billion years — what they reveal
content: Scientists have detected ancient microwave signals from the universe's early days. These signals, over 13 billion years old, offer insights into the Cosmic Dawn. They reveal how the first structures influenced light left over from the Big Bang. This groundbreaking detection was made using Earth-based telescopes. It challenges previous assumptions about where such observations could be made.

title: Thanedar faces racist backlash: Indian-origin US lawmaker calls to abolish ICE
content: After proposing the 'Abolish ICE Act' in response to a fatal Minneapolis shooting, US Congressman Shri Thanedar found himself on the receiving end of online racist attacks targeting his English.

title: I-Pac raids: In SC, ED alleges CM barged in, accuses her of theft; Mamata calls it a ‘blatant lie’
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the ED, told a bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Vipul Pancholi that in the past also, whenever statutory authorities exercised statutory power, Banerjee barged in and interfered.

title: From kingmakers to kin wars: How family feuds are crippling regional parties across states
content: Once kingmakers, many Indian regional parties now grapple with internal strife and leadership crises. From the RJD's family disputes to the Shiv Sena's split and the NCP's factionalism, these parties face significant challenges. Internal conflicts and succession battles are weakening their once formidable influence across the political landscape.

title: WHO urges governments to strengthen taxes on sugary drinks: Doctors welcome the move
content: The WHO is urging governments to hike taxes on sugary drinks, citing their role in fueling obesity and diseases like diabetes, especially in children. Experts emphasize these taxes can curb consumption, generate funds for health services, and encourage healthier choices. This measure is seen as crucial for preventing lifestyle-related illnesses and fostering a healthier generation.

title: Headache for Indian H-1B holders! Visa stamping delays leave many stuck
content: Prolonged visa stamping delays have left many H-1B holders stranded in India, putting them at risk of job losses, pay cuts and potential Indian tax liabilities as interview appointments are pushed back by months.

title: CBSE notice: Advisory for Class 10, 12 students on UGC-recognised colleges; check notice
content: CBSE has issued an advisory to Class 10 and 12 students and affiliated schools regarding admissions to fake universities. The board urges students to verify UGC recognition before applying to higher education institutions to prevent academic and professional setbacks. Schools are directed to counsel students and parents on this critical issue.

title: Watch: British Sikhs rescue schoolgirl from flat, say she was groomed by Afghan man
content: Around 200 Sikhs surrounded a Hounslow council flat Sunday night, alleging an Afghan man was grooming a 16-year-old Sikh girl. Protesters confronted the man, accusing him of manipulation, while a neighbor reported seeing underage girls at the flat over years. Police intervened, taking the man away and reuniting the girl with her family.

title: Explained: Who has alliance with whom in Maharashtra’s civic polls — your guide ahead of results
content: Maharashtra's political landscape is a complex web of shifting alliances as municipal corporation election results loom. Polling for the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation saw varied voter turnout across wards. Key partnerships are forming across Mumbai, Pune, Thane, and other major cities, with major parties like BJP, Shiv Sena factions, NCP factions, and Congress strategizing for victory.

title: Iran unrest: Kashmiri parents seek help to bring children back; write to Centre
content: Kashmiri parents are appealing to the Indian government to evacuate over 10,000 Indian nationals, including students, from Iran due to escalating tensions and an internet shutdown. The Indian Embassy has advised all citizens to leave by any available transport, as Iran closes its airspace amid protests.

title: From pyres to preparation: Where Nagpur’s IAS aspirants study; crematorium turns quiet classroom
content: Youngsters in Nagpur find a quiet sanctuary for competitive exam preparation at a study centre near the Pili river. Located beside the Nari Takshashila Nirvan Ghat crematorium, this municipal facility offers a distraction-free environment. Students benefit from the silence and natural surroundings, aiding their focus. The centre has already seen successful placements in government jobs and railways.

title: IND vs NZ: More than a finisher - KL Rahul makes case for bigger middle-overs role
content: KL Rahul's composed century against New Zealand showcased a newfound clarity and control, a stark contrast to his career's past uncertainties. Batting at number five, he displayed classic ODI prowess, proving old-school techniques still hold value. This assured knock, his first ODI ton since the World Cup, highlights his dedication to establishing a stable role in the team.

title: ‘Did something to them’: Indian-origin woman charged with killing her 2 sons in New Jersey
content: An Indian-origin woman, Priyatharsini Natarajan, has been arrested and charged with the murder of her two young sons in New Jersey. Authorities found the five and seven-year-old boys dead in their home after a 911 call from their father. Natarajan faces two counts of first-degree murder.

title: 'Don't repeat the same mistake': Iran warns Trump amid deadly protests; flags 'Israeli plot'
content: Iran closed its airspace amid US threats over protests, with the foreign minister denying mass casualties and blaming external "terrorists." President Trump warned of action, while Iran extended airspace closure, causing flight disruptions. US personnel were advised to evacuate a base in Qatar as tensions rise.

title: 'Her family warned her': Gisele Bündchen’s family favored Tom Brady over Valente
content: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.
